intro: Lygodictyon schkuhrii, commonly known as the Schkuhrii dodder, is a parasitic flowering plant belonging to the family Convolvulaceae. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host plants for nutrients, typically attaching itself to members of the genus Cucurbita. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked due to its lack of showy blooms. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and the plant can be found in various regions where its host species are present. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant impacts on the growth and yield of its host plants.
